From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Kimberley Purcell <Kimberley.Purcell@chalhoub.com>
CC: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-02-17 14:40
Subject: Proposed Additions to Ounass Contract – Stock Insurance & Liability
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Kimberley,

 

Hope all is well and apologies for the delay.







With reference to the above section of the contract with Ounass, clauses 16.1 to 16.5 are fine as per the version seen above. However, I would suggest adding some additional clauses to hold Ounass responsible for losses to our stock whist in their custody.

 

Proposed Contract Additions:

 

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

chunks.text:
"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

Dear Kimberley,

 

Hope all is well and apologies for the delay.



With reference to the above section of the contract with Ounass, clauses 16.1 to 16.5 are fine as per the version seen above. However, I would suggest adding some additional clauses to hold Ounass responsible for losses to our stock whist in their custody.

 

Proposed Contract Additions:

 

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

chunks.text:
"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

I hope all is well?

Ounass have finally came back with their comments to the latest contract shared with them back in February. Please find attached. 

Mariel from Tax also came back to me with the below:


1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs.

 

2.	Having one agreement to cover all territories is not advisable. Instead, we can have a master agreement with Chalhoub entities in each country included in an addendum and to have the inventory managed by Chalhoub legal entity in each country and the sales & returns recorded locally.


Thanks,
Kim 



KIMBERLEY PURCELL
DIRECTOR ‑ E‑TAILERS
C.G.R. FZE

Subject: Re: Proposed Additions to Ounass Contract – Stock Insurance & Liability 

 

Hi Dana, 

 

I hope all is well?

 

Ounass have finally came back with their comments to the latest contract shared with them back in February. Please find attached. 

 

Mariel from Tax also came back to me with the below:

 

1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational?

chunks.text:
1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational? 

 

2.	Having one agreement to cover all territories is not advisable. Instead, we can have a master agreement with Chalhoub entities in each country included in an addendum and to have the inventory managed by Chalhoub legal entity in each country and the sales & returns recorded locally. We usually have a master agreement but we mention the operating entity in each country in a table (page 2 of the agreement) can you please confirm if each local entity managers inventory/ sales and returns locally?

 

Thanks,

Kim

Subject: Proposed Additions to Ounass Contract – Stock Insurance & Liability

 

Dear Kimberley,

 

Hope all is well and apologies for the delay.



With reference to the above section of the contract with Ounass, clauses 16.1 to 16.5 are fine as per the version seen above. However, I would suggest adding some additional clauses to hold Ounass responsible for losses to our stock whist in their custody.

 

Proposed Contract Additions:

 

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

chunks.text:
"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Hi Dana, 

 

I hope all is well?

 

Ounass have finally came back with their comments to the latest contract shared with them back in February. Please find attached. 

 

Mariel from Tax also came back to me with the below:

 

1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational?

1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational? 

 

2.	Having one agreement to cover all territories is not advisable. Instead, we can have a master agreement with Chalhoub entities in each country included in an addendum and to have the inventory managed by Chalhoub legal entity in each country and the sales & returns recorded locally. We usually have a master agreement but we mention the operating entity in each country in a table (page 2 of the agreement) can you please confirm if each local entity managers inventory/ sales and returns locally?

 

Thanks,

Kim

Dear Kimberley,

 

Hope all is well and apologies for the delay.



With reference to the above section of the contract with Ounass, clauses 16.1 to 16.5 are fine as per the version seen above. However, I would suggest adding some additional clauses to hold Ounass responsible for losses to our stock whist in their custody.

 

Proposed Contract Additions:

 

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

chunks.text:
"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Subject: Re: Proposed Additions to Ounass Contract – Stock Insurance & Liability 

 

Hi Dana, 

 

I hope all is well?

 

Ounass have finally came back with their comments to the latest contract shared with them back in February. Please find attached. 

 

Mariel from Tax also came back to me with the below:

 

1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational?

chunks.text:
1.	Will Ounass hold inventory? If so, under whose name will the goods be cleared into the country – for example when goods are shipped to KSA? This is a critical point to discuss. If Allied’s name will be used to clear goods through customs, this will have significant exposure for Allied in KSA (and all other countries other than the UAE) and Ounass will not be able to return any items back to UAE. If Ounass’ name will be used, the title to the goods must be transferred to Ounass before clearing through customs. Can you please advise on this as it is purely operational? 

 

2.	Having one agreement to cover all territories is not advisable. Instead, we can have a master agreement with Chalhoub entities in each country included in an addendum and to have the inventory managed by Chalhoub legal entity in each country and the sales & returns recorded locally. We usually have a master agreement but we mention the operating entity in each country in a table (page 2 of the agreement) can you please confirm if each local entity managers inventory/ sales and returns locally?

 

Thanks,

Kim 

 

 

 

KIMBERLEY PURCELL

DIRECTOR ‑ E‑TAILERS

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Proposed Additions to Ounass Contract – Stock Insurance & Liability

 

Dear Kimberley,

 

Hope all is well and apologies for the delay.



With reference to the above section of the contract with Ounass, clauses 16.1 to 16.5 are fine as per the version seen above. However, I would suggest adding some additional clauses to hold Ounass responsible for losses to our stock whist in their custody.

 

Proposed Contract Additions:

 

"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

chunks.text:
"16.6 Ounass shall be responsible for any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in its possession, including but not limited to pick-up, storage, handling, and delivery. Ounass shall take all reasonable care to ensure the proper handling and safekeeping of the Products and shall be liable for any damages occurring during this period."

 

16.7 During the Term, Ounass shall maintain adequate insurance coverage with a reputable insurer for the full value of the stock while in its custody, including storage and transit. Such insurance shall cover any loss, theft, or damage to the Products while in Ounass’ possession. Ounass shall not impose any limitation of liability for damages to the Products based on weight, volume, or any other restrictive criteria that could affect insurance claims. Ounass shall provide a copy of the insurance policy to the Merchant upon request."

 

Hope the above satisfies and remain at your disposal should you require any further assistance.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​
